name: Semiconductor - General
description: Sector template for general semiconductor design patents including digital logic, circuit design, and chip architecture.
contextDescription: General semiconductor patents cover chip design, digital logic, and circuit architecture. This sector uses older CPC classifications (pre-2023 H01L reorganization). High-value targets include Intel, AMD, NVIDIA, Qualcomm, Apple, ARM, and all fabless/IDM semiconductor companies. Patents may cover transistor design, logic circuits, power management, or I/O interfaces.
scoringGuidance: Transistor-level patents may be standards-essential or process-dependent.
Digital logic patents have broad applicability across all digital chips.
Power management patents are critical for mobile and data center.
I/O interface patents may target specific standards (PCIe, DDR, USB).
Consider both design patents and implementation patents.

questions.question: At what design level does this patent operate? Score: 1-3 for system-level, 4-6 for RTL/logic, 7-10 for transistor/circuit level.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the design abstraction level (system, logic, circuit, transistor).

questions.question: How relevant is this patent to processor/SoC design? Consider Intel, AMD, ARM, Apple, Qualcomm, NVIDIA.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify processor vendors that would implement this.

questions.question: Does this patent improve power efficiency or power management? Critical for mobile and data center.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess power efficiency improvements and target markets.

questions.question: Does this patent relate to digital interface standards (PCIe, DDR, USB, Ethernet)? Standards patents have licensing potential.
